column4: hi all, i'm having problems automounting my shared partition. Works manually but won't automount, and i'm quite sure i've edited /etc/fstab properly.
pastebin your fstab
http://pastebin.com/d5c737409
exact tabs are important in fstab. and there exists no "relatime". perhaps you mean "realtime"?
anyway the problem i'm having is with the last line only, partition in question is /dev/sda2
your ext3 option is wrong as I told you and the last line need proper tabs
okay thanks. i'll go try read and fix that. the partition is fat32 not ext3.
I know
but I was wrong about the ext3 relatime option
okay... sorry. i'm a bit slow at all this. so how do i fix it? put in the tabs properly?
yes. fat alos needs some options, like uid, gid and the like
/mnt/sda2 vfat umask=077,uid=1000      will that do? i read it off a howto
yes. pretty much
didn't work :( still didn't mount
sorry bout that.
about what?
about not telling you what the problem was. anyway i rebooted and same problem, the shared partition didn't mount
add "auto," int he options
yes. and don't froget the defaults
after that edit, still didn't work
manually mounting it works? pastebin your current fstab
yup i just confirmed that manually mounting works. did sudo mount /dev/sda2 /mnt/osshare and it worked fine. current fstab is http://pastebin.com/m66687dd1
don't. to check your fstab entry, just jsue mount /dev/sda2
somehow, when i didn't change anything the last time i rebooted, it worked. i dunno what you/I did right though. lol. happily ever after for me
